Package com.mygdx.pirategame

Class PirateGame

java.lang.Object
com.badlogic.gdx.Game
com.mygdx.pirategame.PirateGame
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener
public class PirateGame
extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game
The start of the program. Sets up the main backbone of the game. This includes most constants used throughout for collision and changing screens Provides access for screens to interact with each other and the options interface
Author:
Sam Pearson

    • PirateGame

  • Method Details

    • create

      public void create()
      Creates the main body of the game. Establishes the batch for the whole game as well as sets the first screen Also sets up audio interface

    • changeScreen

      public void changeScreen​(int screen, boolean newScreen)
      Changes the screen without killing the prior screen. Allows for the screens to be returned to without making new ones
      Parameters:
      screen - the number of the screen that the user wants to swap to
      newScreen - This boolean is passed to make creating a new game after loading one possible

    • killGame

      public void killGame()
      Kills the game screen and skill tree, so they can be refreshed on next game start

    • killEndScreen

      public void killEndScreen()
      Kill end screens so they can be made again.

    • render

      public void render()
      (Not Used) Renders the visual data for all objects

      Disposes the Pirate Game data
